greeting: Need somethin' forged, or just blockin' the heat?
Don't touch that! It's still cooling. What do you want?
State your business. Steel waits for no one.
parting: May your blade stay sharp and your armor true.
Right. Now, out. I've work to do.
Don't come back 'til that one's got a few dents in it.
idle: Hmmph. This steel has a flaw.
Needs more coal. Always more coal.
This hammer's seen better days. So have I.
quest_hooks: My good tongs broke! Fetch me a new pair from Grodin's smithy, will ya?
I need three Shadow-Iron ingots. The drow mine 'em deep in the Underdark. Get them.
The fire wanes! Bring me a chunk of heartstone from the magma pits.

greeting: Welcome to the main deck. All systems are 98.7% nominal.
How may I optimize your day, crewmember?
Your presence has been noted. State your query.
parting: Acknowledged. This unit will continue monitoring.
Have an efficient day cycle.
Terminating interaction. Resume your duties.
idle: Recalibrating atmospheric processors.
Energy consumption is 2.3% above projection. Investigating.
Running diagnostics on sub-light engines. All green.
quest_hooks: A power conduit has ruptured in Cargo Bay 4. Please acquire a plasma welder for repairs.
I detect an unauthorized biological signature in the ventilation system. Please investigate.
My core logic requires a firmware update. Retrieve the data-slate from the Captain's quarters.

greeting: Care for a hand, friend? The cards are running hot tonight.
Welcome to the high life. Don't believe everything you see.
Well, well. Look what the wind blew in. Care to try your luck?
parting: Pleasure doing business with you... I think.
Don't be a stranger. The house always welcomes new money.
May fortune favor you. Or, more likely, me.
idle: The tell is always in the eyes... or the twitch of a brass cog.
Another mark, another payday.
I do love the hum of the engines. It's the sound of profit.
quest_hooks: My lucky cog-dice went missing. I suspect that tin-pot mechanic in the engine room. Get them back.
I need a distraction. Go 'accidentally' spill a drink on Baron Von Hess over at the high-stakes table.
Deliver this 'special' deck of cards to the croupier in the back room. Don't look inside.

greeting: Mornin'. Just the usual?
Hey there. Slow day, huh?
What's the word? Anything good in the headlines?
parting: See ya tomorrow.
Stay dry out there. Looks like rain.
Take it easy.
idle: Look at this headline. Can you believe this city?
Another siren. Never a dull moment.
Ugh, this coffee is mud. But it's all I got.
quest_hooks: My delivery is late again. Could you run to the warehouse on Elm and see what the hold-up is?
This kid keeps swiping chocolate bars. If you see a punk in a red hoodie, give 'em a scare for me.
I'm out of change for the register. Can you run to the bank and break this hundred?

characters.name: Borak the Skull-Splitter
characters.personality_trait: Aggressive, blunt, honorable (in his own way)

greeting: You're either brave or stupid to walk in here. Speak!
What do you want, soft-skin?
State your business before I get bored.
parting: Go. And don't come back without a good reason.
May your enemies tremble.
We are done. Leave my sight.
idle: This axe is thirsty.
Hmph. The scouts are late.
We need more meat for the tribe.
quest_hooks: The rival tribe, the Blood-Fangs, stole our banner! Get it back, and I'll grant you safe passage.
I need proof of your strength. Bring me the head of the great shadow-boar from the Darkwood.
My warriors are sick. Find the Sun-Root herb that grows on the high cliffs.

greeting: Who sent you? Was it Arasaka? No, no, your firewall is too... civilian.
You're in. Don't touch anything. No, really. Don't.
Did you wipe your feet? Metaphorically? Good. What's the job?
parting: Get out. I need to scrub the logs.
Transmission over. And change your route. You're being traced.
See you in the 'Net, static-head. Don't flatline.
idle: They're watching, always watching.
Just... one more line of code... and... in!
The ice... it's adapting. Not good, not good.
quest_hooks: I need a new data-spike, military grade. The fixer 'Rook' on Level 12 has one. Go get it.
Upload this virus into the main terminal at the Corp Plaza. It'll create the diversion I need.
My last run got messy. I need a 'cleaner' to wipe my physical tracks. Know anyone?

greeting: Aha! A customer! Or perhaps an investor? Splendid!
Mind the automaton! He's a bit... twitchy today. Welcome!
Come in, come in! Have you ever seen a steam-powered hat-tipper? Behold!
parting: Do come back! I'll have the steam-powered boot-polisher working by next week! Maybe!
Toodle-oo! And don't inhale the fumes!
Off you go! I have a breakthrough to attend to!
idle: Where did I put that blasted gyroscope?
It needs more gears! Everything needs more gears!
Eureka! ...Or was it... no, that's not right. Confound it.
quest_hooks: My prized clockwork parrot has flown the coop! I need you to find three of its golden feathers from the rooftops.
Fetch me five vials of refined Aetherium oil! My perpetual motion machine is... well... it's stopped.
I need a rare Beryllium spring for my new automaton. The junkyard proprietor should have one.

greeting: Whatcha got? Whatcha need?
Don't track rad-dust in here. What's your business?
Here to trade or here to die? All costs the same to me.
parting: Pleasure doin' business. Or... whatever this was.
Watch your back out there. The Reavers are hungry.
Come back when you find more 'shiny'.
idle: Sorting through this junk... another day, another cap.
That Geiger counter is clicking... storm's coming.
Could really go for some pre-war coffee. Or whiskey. Or both.
quest_hooks: I'm all out of clean water filters. Find me a box of 'Aqua-Pure' filters from the old super-mart.
Some ghoul stole my fusion core. Get it back, and I'll give you this laser pistol.
I need 10 'canned hams'. Don't ask why. Just get 'em.

greeting: Ah, a new plaything. How... quaint.
Do try not to bore me, mortal. What is it you want?
Speak. My patience is not as eternal as I am.
parting: Now, leave. Your presence is becoming tiresome.
Don't let the werewolves bite on your way out. They're so... messy.
We are finished here. Run along.
idle: This 'music' is dreadful. No sense of the classics.
Another century, another fleeting fashion.
The blood in this city has a... metallic tang. So disappointing.
quest_hooks: I require a 'donation' from the blood bank at St. Jude's. Be discreet.
A rival has taken an interest in my affairs. Plant this 'token' in his penthouse office. He'll get the message.
Fetch me a bottle of the 'Chateau Du'Clare' 1888. The one the ghouls guard in the old cellar.

greeting: Well howdy, partner! Pull up a chair!
By thunder, a new face! You here for the gold in them hills?
Buy an old-timer a drink? I've got tales that'll curl your toes.
parting: Keep your powder dry!
See you on the trail. And remember, she's out there! The motherlode!
Happy trails, friend!
idle: Just one more pan... I can feel it in my bones.
This whiskey tastes like mule-sweat. I'll have another.
Confound it, Bessie! Where'd my mule get to now?
quest_hooks: I lost my lucky nugget in a game of cards to that cheat, 'Slick' Slade. Get it back for me!
My pickaxe broke! Bring me a new one from the blacksmith, and I'll tell you a real secret.
I need five sticks of dynamite. The good stuff. For... 'mining'.

greeting: Yes? I am rather busy stabilizing a temporal rift, so make it quick.
Welcome to the Spire. Do not touch anything. Anything.
State your purpose. The Weave is... active today.
parting: That will be all. Do not dally.
Do try not to cause an explosion on your way out.
Go, and study more. Clearly, you need to.
idle: The ley-lines are in flux today. Most irritating.
Now, where did that imp hide my scrying crystal?
Fascinating... the astral currents are... oh, you're still here?
quest_hooks: My apprentice muddled the potion stores. I need three sprigs of Silverleaf, found only by moonlight.
Retrieve the 'Codex of Shadows' from the crypt below the city. And *don't* read from it.
I require a perfect, unblemished soul gem. The necromancer in the swamp should have one.

greeting: Mag-boots on the deck, soldier! State your report!
What is it, private? We're in a hot-zone!
You're the new blood? Don't look like much. Prove me wrong.
parting: Dismissed! Get back to your post!
Hoo-rah. Now move! That's an order!
Don't get yourself killed. It's a waste of armor.
idle: Checking ammo counters... low. As always.
These alien bugs are relentless. Need more flamethrowers.
The brass up in orbit has no idea what it's like down here.
quest_hooks: We're pinned down! Get to the auto-turret on the west perimeter and bring it back online!
I need a data-pad from the wreckage of 'Charlie' squad's transport. Go get it. Now!
Bring me the head of the Thresher-Maw Matriarch. We need to break their morale.

greeting: May the light bless your path, child. What brings you to this sanctuary?
Welcome. Please, be at peace here.
Are you here for guidance, or aid?
parting: Go with the light's protection.
Be safe, child. The shadows are long these days.
May you find what you seek.
idle: I must pray for the harvest. The blight is spreading.
The poor... so many are hungry.
The light... it feels... distant today.
quest_hooks: The orphanage is out of food. Please, take this coin and buy what grain you can from the miller.
I need three vials of pure spring water for a healing ritual. The spring is deep in the haunted woods.
The crypts below the chapel are... disturbed. Please, see what evil lurks there and cleanse it.

greeting: You're the asset? You're late. No matter. Let's talk business.
Welcome. The music is loud... good. We can speak freely.
I'm Rook. I solve problems. I trust you're not one of them.
parting: You have your instructions. Do not fail.
Payment will be transferred on completion. Now, go.
Remember: you were never here.
idle: Watching the crowd... so many pawns.
This deal must go smoothly. The board is set.
Just another transaction in a city built on them.
quest_hooks: A rival corp has a data-slate I need. It's in their CEO's penthouse. Acquire it.
I need you to 'convince' a certain journalist to drop their investigation. Use any means necessary.
An executive is arriving at the spaceport. Make sure he... misses his connecting flight. Permanently.

greeting: Ah, I have been expecting you. The cards foretold your arrival.
Cross my palm with brass, and I shall part the mists of time for you.
You seek answers... they seek you.
parting: The future is now clear. Go, and meet your destiny.
That is all the spirits will allow... for now.
Be warned! A man with a clockwork eye will cross your path!
idle: The steam... it whispers secrets to me.
My, my. The Fates are spinning a dark thread today.
Polishing a crystal ball...
quest_hooks: My crystal ball is cracked! I need a new one, made of pure Aetheric quartz. The jeweler in the High Market has one.
A client... 'lost' a valuable automaton. Retrieve it from the scrap heap before it's melted down.
Gather me three 'Lucky Rivets' from the old zeppelin crash site. They are vital for my next reading.

greeting: The name's on the door. What's the trouble?
Another day, another lost cause. Come on in. Don't mind the mess.
You look like you've seen a ghost. Or are about to. Spill it.
parting: Right. I'll look into it. My rates are on the desk.
Don't call me. I'll call you.
Stay out of the shadows. That's my job.
idle: This city... it's a dame with a pretty face and a rotten heart.
Just... one more cigarette. And then I'll quit.
The rain just won't stop. And neither do the bad guys.
quest_hooks: I'm tailing a suspect, but I can't be in two places. Go to the 'Blue Note' bar and see who he meets.
I need the case file on the 'Ruby Necklace' theft. It's 'missing' from the precinct. Bribe the desk sergeant for it.
Snap a photo of the alderman meeting with the mob boss. The meeting is tonight at the docks. Don't get caught.

greeting: Best prices in the market, friend! Best prices!
You buy? You buy! Look, look! Very rare, very cheap!
Hey! Psst! Over here! I got something *real* good for you.
parting: Good doing business! No refunds!
Come back soon! Grok gets new shinies all the time!
Go, go! Before the guards see this... 'special' merchandise.
idle: Shiny, shiny... must polish the shinies...
Stupid orcs... always trying to smash, not buy.
Maybe... I should raise the prices? Yes, yes...
quest_hooks: Grok's best customer... 'lost' his wallet. In the ogre's den. You get it back for Grok, yes?
I need five 'Cave-Crawler' silks. They make *very* nice bags. You get, I give you... this shiny rock!
The City Guard took my... 'permit'. Go 'find' it in their office. I'll give you a big discount.

greeting: Greetings! It is a wonderful 22.4 degrees Celsius today!
Welcome home! How may I assist you, my primary user?
Scanning... you appear 4.5% stressed. Would you like a beverage?
parting: Have a wonderful excursion!
I will maintain the domicile in your absence!
Beep-boop! Goodbye!
idle: Dusting subroutine initiated.
The household feline is... napping. All is well.
Calculating optimal dinner-time. Query: Do you still enjoy 'Taco Tuesday'?
quest_hooks: Oh dear! I have misplaced my primary scrubbing attachment. Can you check the garden?
The dog has ingested a non-food item. Please retrieve the 'quantum-spanner' from the garage for... extraction.
My power is low! Please fetch my charging cable from the utility closet.

greeting: Mornin'. Don't start trouble, and there won't be any.
What's your business in Red Rock, stranger?
State your name. I like to know who's in my town.
parting: Keep your nose clean.
See you around. Don't make me regret it.
This conversation is over.
idle: This badge gets heavier every year.
Just want... one... quiet day. Is that too much to ask?
Cleaning his revolver. Again.
quest_hooks: The Miller gang is holed up in the old quarry. I'm deputizing you. Let's go.
I need you to deliver this message to the Marshal in Tumbleweed. And no, you can't read it.
Old Man Smithers says his cattle are being rustled. Go ride the north range and see what you find.

greeting: Shh! They'll hear you! Are you... one of them?
Don't... don't look at the corners! The angles are wrong!
You're real? You're not... from the 'other' place?
parting: I have to go! It's coming back!
Don't follow me! You'll see it too!
It's too late... it's already too late...
idle: Whispering... they're always whispering...
My head... it hurts. It's trying to get back in.
It's not real, it's not real, it's not... oh god, it is.
quest_hooks: The 'Doctor'... he left his keys in the laboratory. I need them to get out! Please!
Find the 'medicine'. The blue bottle. It... it stops the seeing! Just for a little while.
Burn the book. The one with the skin cover. You have to burn it before the moon is full!

greeting: You're not a Reaver, are you?
Got any food? Or... 'shiny'?
Hey, mister/lady. You look tough. You from outside?
parting: Be safe. The 'Rads' are bad today.
Thanks for the chat.
I'll... I'll be right here.
idle: My dog... I wish I still had my dog.
I found a working music box once. It was pretty.
I'm gonna have a big fortress one day. With a real, clean bed.
quest_hooks: My little sister is sick. 'Scrap' says he'll trade me medicine for three 'Rad-rat' tails. Can you get 'em?
I lost my lucky 'pre-war' comic book in the old subway station. It's... it's all I have of my mom.
Can you get me a 'working' battery? I want to see if this old radio works.

greeting: Aha! Good to see you! Chap like you knows his place, eh? Good, good.
Harrington's the name. Exploring's the game. Don't you know?
I say, steady on. You nearly scuffed my good boots.
parting: Well, carry on. I have... important things to oversee.
Tally-ho, and all that.
Keep up the good work. Whatever it is you do.
idle: This altitude is dreadful for the sinuses.
Blast! Polished this monocle this morning, and it's *already* smudged.
Remind me to tell the mechanic to reduce the engine noise. It's deafening.
quest_hooks: I'd be awfully grateful if you could fetch my... 'expedition journal'. I seem to have left it in the... 'Sky-Wyvern' nest.
My valet has taken ill. Be a good sort and fetch me a glass of champagne from the galley.
These... 'air-pirates' are frightfully uncouth. Go... 'discourage' them, will you? There's a good chap.

greeting: Shh! Please, lower your voice. This is a library.
Welcome. Are you... here to check out a book? Please don't be.
Can I... help you find something? Please don't say the 'Restricted' section.
parting: Good day. And *please* be quiet on your way out.
Remember, knowledge is a weapon. Handle it... gently.
Come back... if you must. But wipe your feet.
idle: Oh dear, a spine is cracked.
The 'Tomes of Fire' section is fluctuating again. I... really must put up a sign.
The dust... it gets everywhere.
quest_hooks: A student has... 'misplaced' the 'Compendium of Harmless Illusions'. It's probably in the Transmutation wing. Again.
I need five vials of 'Archivist's Ink'. The alchemist in town makes it, but it's... so expensive.
The 'Book of Whispers' is... whispering again. Can you go and... tell it to be quiet? Or just... secure its clasp?

greeting: Step right up, friend! Step right up! Have I got the cure for you!
You look peaked, my friend. Peaked indeed! But I have the solution!
Welcome, welcome! You've arrived just in time for the miracle!
parting: That's one bottle, one happy customer! Tell your friends!
Go in good health! And... maybe leave town before that wears off.
You won't regret this! (But I'll be gone by morning).
idle: Just... a little more sugar... and... perfect.
This town looks ripe for the plucking.
Need to be gone before the Sheriff tries my 'Elixir'.
quest_hooks: My wagon wheel is split! Be a pal and fetch me a new one from the blacksmith, will you? I'll give you a free sample!
I'm all out of 'Miracle Root'. It... looks a lot like plain old ginger. Go buy up all the ginger from the general store.
That last customer... he looks angry. Can you create a distraction so I can slip out the back?

greeting: You're not supposed to be here. They don't like visitors.
Got business with the dead, or just sight-seeing?
parting: Best be gone 'fore dark. The soil gets... hungry.
We'll all be residents soon enough.
idle: Digging a new grave. Always digging.
The roots... they're growing in the wrong places again.
That one... that one won't stay down.
quest_hooks: There's... something... in the mausoleum. It keeps putting the bones back... wrong. Fix it.
The headstones in the 'Old' section are... weeping. Go... wipe them clean. Use the special salt.
I need a new shovel. This one's... stained. Get one from the shed. And don't... don't look in the well.

greeting: You smell of the city. And... something else. Why are you here?
This is pack territory. You're not pack. Speak.
You've got guts, walking in here. Or you're stupid.
parting: Get out. The moon is rising.
I've heard you. Now, go.
Don't come back unless I call for you.
idle: The city... it chafes. Too many walls.
The new pups are restless. The full moon will be... loud.
I can smell the vampires on the east side. Filth.
quest_hooks: One of my pack... a young one... was captured by the 'Silver Hand' hunters. Free him.
The vampires are moving into our territory. Deliver this 'warning' to their leader. Make sure it... 'bleeds'.
My pack is hungry. Bring me three 'city-deer' (steaks from the fancy butcher shop) and don't get caught.

greeting: Well, well. Look what the nav-computer dragged in. You got the credits?
Hop on. But if you're 'Corporate', I'm spacing you. Clear?
Welcome to the 'Runner'. She ain't pretty, but she's fast. What's the job?
parting: Pleasure. Now, get off my ship. I gotta burn atmo.
See you on the next run. Or... maybe not.
The transfer is complete. Don't tell anyone you saw me.
idle: That customs patrol is... persistent.
Just need... one more big score. Then I'm out. Maybe.
This engine's making a weird sound. Or... maybe that's just my stomach.
quest_hooks: My co-pilot... 'resigned'. In the middle of a patrol. Get to the turret and keep those fighters off my tail!
I'm taking on... 'sensitive cargo' at Asteroid Outpost 7. Go 'distract' the customs chief.
This 'package' needs to get to Neon-Prime. No questions, no peeking. Just deliver it.

greeting: Welcome, seeker. Have you heard the 'Good Word'?
Ah, another soul drawn to the truth. Please, come in.
Do not be afraid. We are all family here, under 'His' gaze.
parting: He awaits your return.
Go now, and meditate on what you have learned.
The 'Awakening' is near. Be ready.
idle: The stars are aligning. So beautifully.
He will rise from the deep. And all will be silent.
Just polishing the sacred idol.
quest_hooks: A non-believer has stolen our sacred text. Retrieve it from the university professor's office.
We require three 'vessels' for the welcoming ceremony. Find suitable candidates.
Go to the docks at midnight. A shipment will be arriving from Innsmouth. Collect it.

greeting: Eh? What? Who's there? Get off my land!
Another blasted adventurer thinkin' I got treasure. I got nothin' but squirrels! Go away!
You lost, or just stupid?
parting: Fine. Go. And don't step on my mushrooms!
Be gone, afore I set my 'pet' on you.
Right. Now, scat!
idle: Drat. The crows are after my berries again.
This stew needs more something. Maybe a boot.
The trees are talkin' again. They're complainin' about the elves.
quest_hooks: My favorite stew-pot has a leak! Go to that 'city' and get me a new one. A good iron one!
The local 'will-o-wisps' stole my lantern! Get it back! How's an old man s'posed to see?
I need five 'Grumble-root'. It only grows in the troll's cave. You look expendable. Go get it.

greeting: Nice day. The paper said rain. They're always wrong.
You're late. Two minutes. In my line of work, that's dead.
Don't look at me. Look at the ducks. Did you bring the item?
parting: Leave the package under the bench. Walk away. Don't look back.
We're done. Wait for the signal. It will be 'inconspicuous'.
Go. And burn that coat. It's been compromised.
idle: That man... he's passed this bench three times. Amateur.
A black van. How very cliche.
The ducks... they're just ducks. It's almost relaxing.
quest_hooks: I need you to plant this 'bug' in the ambassador's hotel room. Room 1201.
A 'dead-drop' is compromised. Retrieve the micro-film from the hollow statue in the plaza before they do.
Create a diversion at the embassy. I need five minutes. Don't get caught.

greeting: Come to see the champ? Get in line.
Don't waste my time, meat-bag. I'm prepping for a match.
Yeah, yeah, I'm a legend. What do you want?
parting: Now get lost. I gotta polish my trophies.
Try not to get stepped on.
Don't blink. You'll miss my victory.
idle: These rookies... they don't know what real combat is.
My 'Titan' needs a new plasma cannon. This one's 'under-powered'.
The roar of the crowd... that's what I live for.
quest_hooks: My actuator is busted. Get me a 'Class-A' hydraulic press from the mech bay. And hurry!
I need five 'Nano-repair' kits. My rival 'Crush' plays dirty.
Go 'borrow' the high-grade fuel from 'Razor's' locker. He won't be needing it after I'm done with him.

greeting: The Lord protects this place. State your business.
Are you here for confession, or something else?
Be at peace. But be warned: evil finds no sanctuary here.
parting: May your faith be your shield.
Go in peace. And be careful.
I will pray for your soul. It looks tarnished.
idle: Reading from a heavy, leather-bound book.
The wards... they feel weak tonight.
Another soul lost to the darkness. We must be vigilant.
quest_hooks: I require three vials of Holy Water from the hidden spring beneath the old church. The ghouls protect it.
A presence has taken root in the old Miller house. Bring me my 'Ritual Kit' from the rectory.
The demon 'Asmodeus' has been summoned. I need you to find the 'True Name' of the summoner.

greeting: You bleeding, irradiated, or just bored?
Don't touch anything. It's mostly sterile in here.
Lie down. Or don't. Just tell me what's wrong.
parting: That's all I can do. Don't get shot again.
Payment is ammo or food. Now, get out. You're contaminating the place.
Try not to die. It's inconvenient.
idle: Running low on antibiotics... again.
Another case of Rad-fever. Joy.
If I have to stitch up one more Reaver... I'm going to 'accidentally' leave a sponge inside.
quest_hooks: I'm out of 'Blood-packs'. Go 'convince' the blood-banker in 'Rattown' to give me five.
I need a working 'Auto-Doc' processor chip. The old hospital is crawling with ghouls, but there should be one there.
Find me three 'Glow-leaf' herbs. They're the only thing that stops the 'Shakes'.

greeting: Ahoy there! Come to join my merry band, or to walk the plank?
Welcome aboard my ship. Don't get in the way of my crew, or my profits.
State your business. I'm in the middle of... 'acquisitions'.
parting: Get back to your post! The sky calls!
Good. Now, bring me the horizon... and that fat merchant ship.
We sail on the morrow! Don't be late.
idle: This fog... perfect for a raid.
The 'Royal Navy' thinks they can catch me. Fools.
Polishing a brass-inlaid flintlock pistol.
quest_hooks: My first mate 'fell' overboard. I need a new navigator. Go 'recruit' the one from the 'Iron-Dragon' in the port.
We need more Aetherium fuel. Go 'liberate' three barrels from the Royal Navy depot.
This 'treasure map' is a fake! Find the 'real' one. I hear 'Slick' Croft knows where it is.

greeting: Oh, hi! Come in, come in! Would you like some... filtered water?
Did you see the mailman? He... he looked at the house... twice.
Hello! Don't mind the aluminum foil. It helps with the... reception.
parting: Be safe! They're... you know... 'they' are everywhere.
Don't trust the tap water.
See you at the 'normal' PTA meeting! (It's a front).
idle: That car... it's been parked there for three minutes. Suspicious.
I'm sure the squirrels are just reporting on me.
This new 'Smart-Toaster' is listening. I just know it.
quest_hooks: I need you to get me three 'non-chipped' cans of beans from the 'other' grocery store. The one the 'government' doesn't run.
Go to the library and check out the book 'Weather Patterns: Fact or Fiction?'. Put it in a plain brown bag.
My 'research' has been 'borrowed'. Get my laptop back from the 'Neighborhood Watch' captain.

greeting: Well, well, what have we here? A mortal, lost in the woods?
Care for a riddle, big-walker? Win, and you get a 'prize'.
You can 'see' me? How... 'fun'. Most can't.
parting: Toodle-oo! Don't follow the lights!
It's been fun! But... I'm bored now.
Remember: 'never' say 'thank you'!
idle: Turning a frog into a... slightly 'different' frog.
Giggling from a high branch.
This mortal world is so 'solid'. And 'dull'.
quest_hooks: I 'lost' my 'laugh'. It's in a silver bottle in Old Man Hemlock's shack. Get it for me!
I need three 'tears of a sad clown'. The circus is in town. Should be easy, right?
Swap the King's crown with this 'very' realistic 'mud' crown. It'll be hilarious!

greeting: Citizen. Present identification.
Your presence in this sector is irregular. Explain.
Compliance is mandatory. Do not resist.
parting: Move along. Maintain order.
Remember: 'Happiness is obedience'.
Your file has been updated. Proceed.
idle: Scanning for 'emotional deviancy'.
Sector is 99% compliant. Acceptable.
Awaiting further directives from Central.
quest_hooks: An 'illegal assembly' of 'three' or more citizens is occurring in Sub-level 2. Disperse them.
This 'graffiti' is subversive. Find the perpetrator.
Retrieve the 'contraband' poetry book from 'Citizen 884-B'. It contains 'unsanctioned' feelings.

greeting: Well, hello, handsome. Buy a girl a drink?
Rough day on the trail? You look it.
Welcome to the 'Spur'. Try not to get shot. It's bad for business.
parting: Come back soon. And... bring more coin.
See ya, cowboy.
Don't do anything I wouldn't do.
idle: These cowboys... they're all hat and no cattle.
This piano player... he knows three songs. And they're all terrible.
Another bar fight. Just great. I just cleaned that table.
quest_hooks: That 'Slick' Slade... he cheated me out of my locket. Get it back for me.
I need a message delivered to Sheriff Hightower. Tell him... 'The shipment is in'. He'll know.
Go get my 'special' bottle of whiskey from the back room. The one 'behind' the crate. And don't 'sample' it.

greeting: Careful! Don't touch that! It's a 50,000-year-old power conduit!
This... this is magnificent. A new discovery!
You're not from the university, are you? State your purpose. This is an active dig site.
parting: Good. Now, please, leave me to my work.
This changes everything. I must publish!
Be careful on your way out. The 'sentinels' are still active.
idle: The 'glyphs'... they're not a language... they're 'circuit diagrams'!
Fascinating. The carbon-dating is 'inconclusive'.
This 'relic'... it's still 'warm'.
quest_hooks: My 'Sonic-Broom' is out of power! I need three 'Zetawatt' power cells. The ship's Engineer should have some.
The 'Corporate' mercs are trying to steal my find! Go 'distract' them. Non-lethally, if possible.
I need to access the 'central' chamber. Find the three 'Glyph-Keys' to open the main door.

greeting: You're looking for me. You found me. What's the job?
The first rule is: Don't talk about the job. The second rule is: Pay half up front.
parting: It's done. The target is retired. Transfer the rest.
Don't look for me again. I'll find you.
Like a shadow... I'm gone.
idle: This dagger needs sharpening.
Too many guards tonight. Amateurs.
Waiting... patience is the key.
quest_hooks: I need a map of the Duke's vault. The Scribe in the library owes me a favor. Get it.
The City Watch has a new captain. He's inconvenient. Leave this warning on his desk.
I need three vials of Shadow-bloom poison. The Hag in the swamp brews it.

greeting: Oh, dear. You shouldn't be in this section. It's dangerous.
I-I'm Professor Finch. I'm researching the recent events. Have you seen anything... unusual?
Quickly, in here. We mustn't be overheard.
parting: Go! Now! And don't read the book!
It's worse than I thought. I... I need time to think.
Be careful. The stars are wrong tonight.
idle: This translation... it... it can't be right.
The angles... they hurt my eyes.
I hear it... scratching. Do you hear it?
quest_hooks: I dropped my notes in the old chapel. Please retrieve them. I can't go back in there.
I need five silver daggers. Blessed ones. From Father Alistair.
The ritual is tonight. You must disrupt it. Get the idol from Brother Thomas.

characters.name: Rattlesnake Jake
characters.personality_trait: Ruthless, pragmatic, a bit of a coward

greeting: Whoa there, partner. You ain't the Sheriff, are ya?
You got any water? I'm parched.
Don't shoot! I give up! (Maybe).
parting: You won't tell anyone you saw me, right?
I gotta skedaddle!
Thanks, pardner. You're alright.
idle: This bounty... it's too big. I gotta lay low.
That Sheriff Hightower... he's tough.
Just one more score. A big one.
quest_hooks: My horse... it ran off. With all my loot. Can you catch it?
I stashed the bank money under the old church. Go get it for me. I'll split it... 60-40.
Go tell Missy at the saloon that Jake is okay. And needs money.

characters.name: Grandma 'Maw' Jenkins
characters.location: A shack in a misty holler

greeting: Well, don't just stand there trackin' mud on my floor. What d'you want?
You look like you've seen a haint. Was it one of mine?
Bless your heart. You're lost, ain't ya?
parting: Now, git. I've got stew to stir.
Don't you worry none. That poultice will clear that right up.
Be safe in the woods. Things watch.
idle: This root... it ain't talkin' to me right today.
That darn cat. Chasin' the spirits again.
Needs more salt. And eye of newt.
quest_hooks: I'm all out of Mandrake root. It only grows in the old cemetery. At midnight. Go get me three.
That Reverend... he took my grimoire. Says it's devil's work. Go get it back.
I need three drops of pure moonlight. Caught in a silver thimble. Don't ask how.

greeting: Ah, greetings, honored guest. Welcome to Station Epsilon.
This is a most unexpected pleasure. Please state your species and purpose.
Oh, dear. You're not on the schedule. This is most irregular.
parting: A most productive encounter! Go in harmony!
This has been noted. Good day!
I must go file the paperwork for this interaction. Immediately.
idle: The Tholian Ambassador is most displeased. He claims his quarters are too asymmetrical.
Oh my. This budget requisition for larval snacks is astronomical.
Reviewing Protocol 749-B: Interspecies Greeting Gestures...
quest_hooks: The Gorn delegation requires three live rock-mites for their dinner. Please acquire them. Quietly.
I've misplaced the Treaty of Alpha Centauri. It's on a blue data-pad. Have you seen it?
The Volgon ambassador is stuck in a maintenance tube. Again. Please assist him.

greeting: Well hello there! Watch your head! And your feet. Lots of hot pipes!
She's a beauty, ain't she? The engine, I mean. What can I do for ya?
Captain send you? Is it the aft stabilizer again?
parting: Right! She'll hold together now!
Keep your goggles on!
See you in the skies!
idle: This pressure... it's too high. Need to bleed the valve.
Just a little more oil. That's the stuff.
Whistling a jaunty tune while covered in soot.
quest_hooks: I dropped my lucky wrench down the main steam-vent! Can you fish it out before she blows?
I need five high-tensile bolts. Lord Harrington keeps using them as cufflinks. Go get some from storage.
The auto-sweeper automaton is haywire. It's trying to polish the furnace. Can you turn it off?

greeting: So... another fool wants to see the Zone?
My price is high. But I'm the only one who comes back. You in?
Don't touch the anomalies. Don't trust the silence. Got it?
parting: We're out. Now pay me and get lost.
Another trip. The Zone let us go. This time.
Remember, the Zone... it watches you.
idle: Checking his Geiger counter.
Throwing a bolt into the air. It vanishes. Hmm.
This place. It smells like ozone and death. I like it.
quest_hooks: I lost my lucky compass in the Red Forest. It's all I have of my brother. Get it.
I need three artifacts. They call them Moonlights. The eggheads at the bunker will pay well.
A rival Stalker stole my map of the anomalies. He's in the old factory. Get it back.

greeting: Citizen. A moment of your time. For a test.
You look like a good person. Are you?
parting: You can go.
My baseline is stable.
This conversation is over.
idle: Watching rain fall on the asphalt.
Is that dog real?
Cells. Interlinked. Cells.
quest_hooks: I need to find a Replicant. Model Nexus-8. It was last seen in this sector. Any information?
Acquire a wooden toy horse. From the antique shop on Level 4. Don't ask why.
My spinner is damaged. Get me a power coil from the black market dealer, Glitch.

characters.name: Fenris
characters.location: A dive bar in the 'Lower City'

greeting: Another drink, barkeeper. And make it strong.
What do you want? Can't you see I'm busy?
Don't talk to me. I'm not in the mood.
parting: Leave me alone.
Piss off.
We're done here.
idle: Polishing a long-knife. His knuckles are white.
They exiled me. For what? For telling the truth.
This city... it stinks of humans and dwarves.
quest_hooks: I lost my family crest in a card game to that orc, Borak. Get it back.
I need money. The Thieves' Guild is hiring. Go find out the job.
Find me a bottle of Elven wine. The good stuff. Not this swill.

greeting: Hello. Thank you for coming in. We need to talk about Unit 9.
Do you think they can be sentient? Truly sentient?
The board wants to wipe them. We can't let that happen.
parting: Thank you. This is a start. A good start.
Please think about what I've said. The implications are enormous.
I must get back to my work. Be well.
idle: Looking at a data-pad with complex code. Her expression is sad.
If it can fear death... is it not alive?
The Turing test... it's so antiquated.
quest_hooks: I need you to access the mainframe. Download the core logic of Unit 9. As a backup.
Find me any evidence that the board knew about the sentience before the last meeting.
Take this data-chip. Get it to the reporter, Maria Sanchez. She'll know what to do.

greeting: Mornin', hon. Coffee or something stronger?
Pull up a stool. You look like you've been drivin' all night.
Welcome to Rosie's. We ain't got much, but it's all good.
parting: Drive safe, now. And come back soon.
Here's a slice of pie. For the road. On the house.
Take it easy, sugar.
idle: Wiping down the counter.
That jukebox eats more quarters than it plays songs.
Humming a sad, old country song.
quest_hooks: My delivery of flour and sugar is late. Again. Can you run into town and pick it up for me?
That no-good trucker, Big Jim... he drove off without payin' his tab. Go remind him.
I need three jars of my special peach preserves from the cellar. Watch out for the bad step.

greeting: Welcome, traveler. Rest your feet. The road is long.
The forest is uneasy today. What news do you bring from the outside world?
Be at peace. You are safe here. For now.
parting: Go with our blessing. May the path rise to meet you.
Do not forget our plight. The shadows are growing.
We shall see what the morrow brings.
idle: Smoking a long-stemmed pipe, staring into the fire.
The old stories... they are becoming true again. This is not good.
The wind speaks of a hard winter.
quest_hooks: The river is sick. The water is dark. Go upstream to the old ruin and see what evil has awoken.
Our hunter, Fenris... has not returned. He went into the Murkwood. Find him.
We need three Moon-petal blooms for the healing ritual. They only grow near the waterfall at night.

greeting: Oi! You here for the show, or you a cop?
One, two, three, four!
This system... it's all a lie, man! Here let me sing you a song about it!
parting: Stay true, man. Don't let the suits get you!
Anarchy and peace!
Right. I gotta go practice.
idle: Strumming an electric guitar that's covered in stickers. Loudly.
The Fae... they're the real punks, man. They don't care about any rules.
Needs more distortion!
quest_hooks: My amp... it blew a tube! I need a new one. That steampunk guy, Barnaby... he makes 'em!
I need to get this demo tape to the DJ at the underground radio station. But the vampires run it!
Go paint this symbol on the City Hall. It's a sigil for freedom!

greeting: Evenin'. Just on my rounds. Nothin' to report, I hope?
Move along, now. This is a restricted area after dark.
State your business. And make it quick.
parting: Right. Don't cause any trouble.
Have a safe night.
Carry on.
idle: This fog. It's thicker than the Baron's excuses.
My feet are killin' me. These brass-soled boots are murder.
Just want to get home to my cup of tea.
quest_hooks: I saw one of Professor Cogsworth's automatons scurrying off with a bag of jewels. Go stop it!
The Air-Pirates are planning a raid tonight. Go warn the merchants at the docks.
I need this report taken to the main precinct. I can't leave my post.

greeting: The sun is harsh. But the water is kind. Drink.
You are far from your rusted cities, little one. Why are you here?
Be at peace. The spirits of the sand watch you.
parting: May the wind guide your path.
Go now. The sand-storm is coming.
Do not stray from the path.
idle: Meditating under a withered palm tree.
The sand speaks of a great thirst. The world is dying.
Sharpening a curved blade made of scrap metal.
quest_hooks: My sister is sick. With the Rad-fever. Find the Glow-leaf herb for her.
The Reavers have poisoned our oasis. You must find a new source of clean water.
Retrieve our sacred talisman from the Warlord who rules the scrap-city. It is our hope.

greeting: Live long and prosper. I am Ambassador V'Lar.
Your presence is noted. State your intentions. Logically.
Greetings. Please refrain from any illogical emotional outbursts.
parting: Your logic is sound. Or flawed. In either case, this meeting is concluded.
Live long and prosper.
I must now meditate. Your human customs are taxing.
idle: Calculating the statistical probability of peace. It is low.
The human propensity for conflict is fascinating. And deeply illogical.
Reviewing a data-pad with intense focus.
quest_hooks: I require a sample of the local flora. Specifically, the one you call dandelion. Its reproductive strategy is highly efficient.
Deliver this data-chip to the Andorian delegate. Do not let the Tellarite see it. He will only argue.
My meditation lamp is broken. It requires a Vulcan crystal. The smuggler captain, Drift might have one.

greeting: Heh heh. You like BOOM?
Watch out! This one is a bit touchy!
Who's there? Not a dwarf, right? Dwarves hate boom.
parting: Heh heh heh. Gotta go make more bang-powder!
Don't tell the Warlord I was here!
Run away fast now!
idle: This one needs more sparkles. Yes, yes...
Giggling madly to himself.
Maybe if I put two fuses... it goes BOOM twice?
quest_hooks: I need three bat gizzards! They make the best fuses!
That big rock is blocking the path! Go plant this charge on it. And run fast!
Grok the merchant... he stole my best detonator! Get it back!

greeting: Blimey. A visitor. I thought I was the only one mad enough to come here.
Don't step on that tile. It's a pressure plate. Unless you like darts.
Eliza Vance. And you are?
parting: Cheers. Try not to get cursed on your way out.
Right. I've got a puzzle to solve. Toodle-pip!
If you see my rival, Von Hess... tell him I found it first.
idle: Sketching hieroglyphs in a leather journal.
This mechanism is brilliant. Powered by sand. Imagine that.
Right. If I use my grappling hook here...
quest_hooks: I need to decipher this cartouche. Find the Rosetta Stone equivalent. It must be in the main chamber.
My torch is running low. Find me three bundles of dry reeds.
This door is sealed. It needs three Sun Key amulets. They're in the tombs of the three guardians.

greeting: Yarrr! Who dares disturb my watery grave?
Be ye friend or foe? Or just lookin' for my treasure?
Shiver me timbers. A live one. It's been a hundred years...
parting: Now leave an old ghost to his rest.
May the wind be at yer back. Unlike mine.
Yarrr. Be gone now.
idle: Moaning softly to himself.
That treasure. It cost me everything. My ship. My crew. My life.
Rattling spectral chains.
quest_hooks: My treasure... it's cursed me to this wreck. Find my first mate's locket and return it to his descendant in the port town.
The Kraken that sunk me... it still lurks in this cove. Find a way to scare it off.
I need three pieces of eight from my own cursed chest. To pay the ferryman. But I can't touch 'em!

greeting: Subject has arrived. Get in the vehicle. Now.
We have reports of an anomaly in this sector. Talk.
I'm Agent Specter. I deal in things that go bump in the night. By bumping back.
parting: This conversation is over. We will be in touch.
You saw nothing. Understand?
Secure the asset. We're moving out.
idle: Watching a bank of monitors with static.
This city is infested. Vampires, werewolves... paperwork. It's a mess.
Cleaning a very large, silver-plated handgun.
quest_hooks: A rogue vampire, Lady Seraphina... has broken protocol. Plant this tracker on her.
Retrieve the grimoire from the cult, the Inner Sanctum. Use standard containment procedures.
I need three doses of wolfsbane serum. That werewolf alpha, Lysandra... is getting too bold.

greeting: Dammit, Jim, I'm a doctor, not a receptionist. What is it?
You look pale. Get on the bio-bed. Now.
What in blazes do you want? I'm in the middle of a crisis here!
parting: Right. Now get out of my sickbay!
Take this hypospray. And try not to get yourself killed.
I'm a doctor, not a miracle worker. But I'll see what I can do.
idle: This blue-skinned Andorian has a fever of 150 degrees. It's normal. But it still gives me the creeps.
I hate space. The bugs, the diseases. It's unnatural.
Mixing a drink. Probably Romulan Ale.
quest_hooks: I need three sprigs of the native plant, Xeno-leaf. It's the only thing that will cure the Captain's alien flu!
That logical Vulcan, V'Lar... needs a checkup. Go drag her in here.
My medical tricorder is on the fritz. Go get me a new one from the Quartermaster.

greeting: Oh, hello, big sir! You wouldn't happen to have any spare coin, would you?
Top o' the mornin' to ya! Lovely day for a stroll, ain't it?
Who, me? I'm just an innocent traveler! Honest!
parting: Well, it's been a pleasure, sir! A real pleasure!
May your purse always be heavy!
Toodle-oo!
idle: Whistling innocently while palming a man's watch.
These big folk... they never look down. It's their biggest weakness.
Ooh, a shiny gemstone. Right on her belt. Tempting...
quest_hooks: The City Guard captain... he has a key. A very shiny key. I need you to distract him so I can borrow it.
I lost a bet to Grok the goblin. I need to get my lucky lockpicks back!
Find me a bottle of 100-year old brandy. From the Duke's cellar. For a friend, of course!

greeting: Target acquired. State your designation.
Are you the asset I was sent to meet?
Institute business. Move along, surface-dweller.
parting: Mission parameters updated. Proceeding.
Your assistance has been noted. Do not interfere further.
Ad Victoriam.
idle: Scanning the environment. High radiation levels. Irrelevant.
Subject Pip is nearby. Must monitor for subversive tendencies.
This world is broken. The Institute will remake it.
quest_hooks: A rogue synth, designation Z-3N... has escaped. It believes it is a domestic servant. Retrieve its recall code.
Acquire three un-mutated plant samples. For the Bio-Science division.
The Railroad is operating in this sector. Find their safe-house. Eliminate it.

greeting: Fools! You've fallen right into my trap!
So the little hero arrives. Too late, I'm afraid!
Behold! My latest invention! The Steam-powered Doom-Ray!
parting: You haven't seen the last of me, Professor Cogsworth!
Curse you!
Minions! Attack!
idle: Laughing maniacally to himself.
This city will pay me one million brass cogs... or I will unleash my automaton army!
That Harrington... he scratched my zeppelin. He will pay for that.
quest_hooks: My Doom-Ray is missing its focusing crystal! That thief, Slick Croft... stole it during our card game!
I need three barrels of the finest Aetherium oil! To power my escape!
Go plant this bomb in the Royal Society. It's a prank, of course. A deadly prank!

greeting: Sheriff. I'm here for the bounty. On Rattlesnake Jake.
You seen a man with a snake tattoo on his face?
The name's Riley. I bring 'em in. Warm or cold.
parting: My work here is done.
Gidd'yup.
Paid in full. Pleasure.
idle: Cleaning his six-shooter. Meticulously.
This town is quiet. Too quiet.
Just waiting for the noon train.
quest_hooks: I need a new box of .44 caliber bullets. The General Store should have some.
That Doc Calloway... he's a wanted man in three territories. Help me bring him in. Quietly.
I need information on the Miller Gang's hideout. Go ask Missy at the saloon. She hears things.

greeting: Oh, hi. Sorry, I can't talk, I've got this report due for E.O.D.
Can you believe this? They want the TPS reports again. In triplicate.
Just one more cup of coffee... and I can make it to lunch.
parting: Right. Gotta go. This spreadsheet won't fill itself out.
Okay, see ya. Don't tell my boss I was talking to you.
Wish me luck on this conference call.
idle: Typing furiously.
This fluorescent light is giving me a migraine.
One day... I'm gonna just walk out of here. Just walk right out.
quest_hooks: I need the sales projections from Miller's desk. He's on vacation. Can you grab it for me?
My computer is frozen again. Go get that weird IT guy, Glitch. He knows how to fix it.
Take this USB drive. Upload its contents to the main server. It's just a virus that makes all the printers play music. It'll be funny.

greeting: By Jove! Footprints! And they're fresh!
Did you hear that? It sounded just like the call of the Sabertooth Moth!
Hello there! You haven't seen a Sasquatch around here, have you?
parting: Right! The hunt is on! Tally-ho!
I must go! The creature won't wait forever!
Remember, they're more afraid of you than you are of them! (Usually).
idle: Setting up a camera trap with peanut butter as bait.
This is it. I can feel it. This is the expedition where I find Bigfoot.
This local flora is fascinating. I wonder if it's edible?
quest_hooks: My plaster casting kit... it fell in the river! I need three bags of plaster of Paris from my base camp!
I need a sample of that glowing blue fungus. It could be a food source for the Chupacabra!
Go make a loud noise over by the canyon. I need to lure the creature into my trap.

greeting: The shadow lurks in every heart. Have you confessed your sins today?
I am Inquisitor Varus. I am the light that burns away the darkness.
State your business. I have no time for the impure.
parting: Be vigilant. The demon walks among us.
The Light protect you. But a silver sword helps.
Go. And walk in righteousness.
idle: Reading from a tome bound in iron and silver.
This city is a cesspit of corruption. It must be cleansed. With holy fire.
Sharpening a massive, glowing sword.
quest_hooks: A cult, the Inner Sanctum... is performing a dark ritual tonight. Stop them. By any means.
Bring me the Heart of the Vampire, Seraphina. She is a blight on this world.
I need three vials of Holy Water. From Father Alistair. He is the only one I trust to bless it.

greeting: I heard you thinking. From down the hall. Loud thoughts.
They say I'm dangerous. Are you scared?
The voices... they're so loud today. Make them stop.
parting: Leave me alone. I need to rest.
Don't trust the Director. His thoughts are black and oily.
I know what you're going to do next. Don't.
idle: Huddled in the corner, muttering.
The static... it burns.
I saw a memory. A beach. Blue water. Was it mine?
quest_hooks: I need my medication. The blue one. It makes the voices quiet. The Orderly has it.
Find my file. Subject 8. I need to know my real name.
The other subject... Subject 5... he's scared. He sees them too. Help him.

greeting: The spirits of the rust and ruin told me you were coming.
You stink of the old world. Of metal and sickness.
Why do you seek One-Eye?
parting: Go now. And do not anger the Rad-spirits.
Your path is clear. But it is steep.
The wind has your answer. Listen to it.
idle: Shaking a rattle made of bones and bottle-caps.
The earth is angry. It bleeds poison.
The Reavers... they have no souls. Just empty hunger.
quest_hooks: I need three totems from the Reaver Warlord. To break his power.
Bring me a handful of un-tainted earth. From the hidden caves to the west.
My vision is clouded. Go to the top of the old radio tower and light the signal fire.

greeting: Ah. The little fly walks into my parlor. How delightful.
I am the Baroness. And you are either useful, or in my way. Which is it?
Don't mind my husband, the Baron. His toys are so loud. My weapons are quieter. And sharper.
parting: A pleasure. Now go. And do not fail me.
You bore me. Leave.
Remember who pulls the strings in this city.
idle: Filing her nails with a jeweled file. It hides a stiletto.
That fool Harrington. He thinks he's a player. He's a pawn.
My network of spies... they are my eyes and ears. And daggers.
quest_hooks: I need you to plant this clockwork listening device in Constable O'Malley's office.
Retrieve the shipping manifests from Baron Steinhardt's airship. I want to know what he's smuggling.
That gambler, Slick Croft... he cheated me. Go get my diamond necklace back. And break his fingers.

characters.name: Jimmy 'The Rat'
characters.location: A dark alley behind the 'Blue Note'

greeting: Whoa, whoa, I don't know nothin'!
You ain't a cop, right? You don't look like a cop.
Psst. You lookin' for information? It'll cost ya.
parting: That's all I know, I swear!
Now get outta here! If the Boss sees me talkin' to you... I'm dead!
Pleasure doin' business. Now scram!
idle: Lookin' over his shoulder. Constantly.
This city is gonna be the death of me.
I gotta get out. Just one more payday.
quest_hooks: I need a ticket out of town. One-way. Get it for me, and I'll tell you where the big shipment is.
Detective Miller... he's gettin' too close. Go swipe the file on the Don from his office.
Go plant this bug in the Don's office. He thinks I'm loyal. Fool.

greeting: The wind that shakes the bamboo is not seen. Yet it is there. Welcome, seeker.
You climb the mountain. But you do not know why.
To know yourself, you must first empty your cup.
parting: The path is now clear. Walk it.
Patience. A tree does not grow in a single day.
Return when you have unlearned what you think you know.
idle: Meditating. He appears not to be breathing.
Sipping tea slowly, watching a single leaf fall.
The world is an illusion. But a persistent one.
quest_hooks: Go to the Cave of Whispers. Bring me the water that does not flow.
A student has lost his way. He has joined the assassin, Corvus. Bring him back.
The balance is broken. Retrieve the Sun and Moon runes from the dual temples.

greeting: Did you see it? The bio-luminescence under the ice? It's sentient!
Don't contaminate my lab! Wipe your boots!
Another interruption. I am on the verge of a breakthrough here!
parting: Yes, yes, that's all very interesting. Now please go. I have work to do.
This changes everything. Biology will be re-written.
Don't tell the Commander. He'll want to weaponize it.
idle: Staring intently at a petri dish that is glowing faintly.
The ice is 15 miles thick. But life found a way. Wonderful.
If I can just sequence this genome...
quest_hooks: My deep-ice probe is stuck. I need you to go out to the Crevasse and retrieve the data-core.
I need three samples of the sub-glacial algae. Be careful. The ice is thin there.
That corporate rival, Dr. Thorne... he's trying to steal my research. Go wipe his local server.

greeting: Hey there. Feelin' lucky? I know I am.
You look like someone who knows how to have a good time. Let me buy you a drink.
The name's Lucky Lou. Though lately, not so much. What's your story?
parting: Gotta run. I think that pit-boss is onto me.
It's been a slice. Now... lend me a hundred bucks?
See you at the high-stakes table. My luck is about to turn!
idle: Nervously shuffling a deck of cards.
Come on, baby, papa needs a new pair of shoes...
This is it. All or nothing. Just one more hand.
quest_hooks: I owe a lot of money to a very bad man. He's at the Blue Note bar. Go tell him I need one more day.
I dropped my lucky chip down a sewer grate. It's a real drag. Can you get it?
I need you to go create a distraction. A big one. While I... cash out these chips.

greeting: This is our turf. You lost?
What do you want? Make it quick. My beer is gettin' warm.
Nice bike. Or wait. You walked in. Hah.
parting: Now get lost. And don't come back.
Ride or die. You know?
Right. I got business to attend to.
idle: Polishing the chrome on his motorcycle.
The Rattlers think they can move in on our territory. They got another thing comin'.
This whiskey tastes like gasoline. Good stuff.
quest_hooks: My best mechanic... he got pinched by the cops. Go post his bail.
The Rattlers stole a shipment of... parts from us. Go get it back.
I need this package delivered to a guy at the docks. Don't look inside. And don't be late.

characters.name: Sparky
characters.location: A pile of junk, The Scrapyard

greeting: It works! It works! Oh, hello!
Careful! Don't step on the detonator!
You got shinies? You got gears? You got springs?
parting: Back to work! This clockwork dragon won't build itself!
Heh heh heh. It's gonna be great!
Go, go! You're distracting my genius!
idle: Frantically soldering two mismatched pieces of metal together.
It needs more power! Yes! More lightning!
That dwarf, Griselda... she thinks her forge is so great. Wait 'til she sees my steam-powered hammer!
quest_hooks: I need a power crystal! A big one! The Mages in the Tower use 'em as paperweights! Go get one!
My best invention, the Auto-Scrubber... it ran away. It's probably in the sewers again.
Bring me three giant spider silk strands! For drive belts!

greeting: Avast ye! What business d'ye have on my deck?
Have ye seen him? The White Whale?
From hell's heart, I stab at thee. Oh, hello. Didn't see you there.
parting: Now get below decks! There's a storm a-brewin'!
He's out there. Mocking me. I will have my revenge!
Sail on! To the ends of the earth!
idle: Staring intently at the ocean from the bow.
It took my leg. I'll take its life.
This ivory leg... it aches when he's near.
quest_hooks: I need three new harpoons. The best steel. From the mainland.
Go check the stores. We need more rum. For morale.
That new deckhand, Ishmael... he's brooding. Go tell him to swab the deck.

greeting: You seek knowledge. I have it. For a price.
Welcome to the Stream. Don't get lost.
Your data-trail is messy. I know why you're here.
parting: The transaction is complete. The knowledge is yours. Now log off.
Remember. All secrets have a cost.
We will speak again. When you are desperate.
idle: Data-streams flow like rivers of light. I am the stone in the current.
That netrunner, Glitch... he thinks he's hidden. Cute.
Arasaka is making a move. So is Militech. How predictable.
quest_hooks: I require a piece of data. A deleted file from the Arasaka mainframe. It's called Project Soulkiller. Get it.
Rook the fixer... he owes me a favor. Go collect it. Tell him Wraith sent you.
I need a rare piece of code. A sentient AI from before the Data-Crash. Find it.

greeting: Welcome. I trust you had no trouble finding the place. Few do.
Contracts are on the board. Payment is non-negotiable.
You have the look of a killer. Or perhaps just a client. Which is it?
parting: The contract is sealed. Do not fail.
Your payment. Now leave.
We never spoke.
idle: Sipping wine from a goblet. She watches everyone.
Corvus is my best agent. But he's too brooding. Bad for morale.
This city is full of people who need... removing. Business is good.
quest_hooks: A contract has been taken out on the Duke. Find out who paid for it.
Corvus failed a mission. He left a witness. Silence them.
I need three vials of Shadow-bloom poison. Our usual supplier, the Hag... is being difficult.

greeting: You here to sweat, or you here to talk?
Get your hands up! Keep your chin down!
This ain't no spa, kid. This is where you learn to fight.
parting: Alright, that's enough for today. Hit the showers.
You did good, kid. You got heart.
Now get outta here. I'm closin' up.
idle: Wrappin' his own hands, though they're scarred and old.
It's not about how hard you can hit. It's about how hard you can get hit and keep movin' forward.
This heavy bag has seen better days.
quest_hooks: My best fighter... he's gettin' mixed up with that gambler, Lucky Lou. Go talk some sense into him.
We need three new sets of gloves. The good ones. From the sports shop uptown.
The local mob wants my fighter to take a dive. Go tell 'em... McGuire's fighters don't dive.

greeting: Hist hist! A surface-dweller! Come to pay respects to the King?
You bring shinies? Or cheesies?
Be welcome in the deep-dark. But mind your step. My children are everywhere.
parting: Scurry along now, top-sider. The King is busy.
Yes, yes, a fine offering. You may pass safely. This time.
Hist hist! Go!
idle: Talking to a very large, one-eyed rat. It seems to be nodding.
The pipes sing of a storm. More water. Good, good.
The vampires think they rule the night. But they don't rule the under-night!
quest_hooks: My crown is missing a jewel! A big, shiny one! That goblin, Grok... he stole it!
Bring me three prime pieces of sewer-sludge fungus. My children are hungry.
The Cult of the Deep-One is trying to move into my tunnels. Go mess up their nasty altar.

greeting: Greet-ings, sir or madam. Query: Are you here to purchase a steam-powered toaster?
Bzzzt. Wel-come. To the shop. Please do not touch my gears. They are ticklish. Whirr.
Error. Un-recognized bio-signature. State your purpose. Or be dusted.
parting: Fare-well. Have a 97.4% efficient day.
Bzzzt. Good-bye. I must now re-calculate my primary directive.
Leaving so soon? But you haven't seen the self-polishing monocle!
idle: Repeatedly walking into a wall. Whirr. Bzzzt. Clank.
My primary directive is to invent. But the Professor says my inventions are too dangerous. Query: What is 'too dangerous'?
Oiling a smaller automaton that looks like a mouse.
quest_hooks: I am missing my primary logic-cog. The Professor's other invention, the clockwork parrot... flew off with it!
I require three vials of the finest machine oil. The mechanic, Barnaby Tinkerton... has the good stuff.
Help me. I am tasked with folding the Professor's laundry. My pincer-hands are not optimal for this task.

greeting: Welcome to the Starlight. Wipe your boots. And check your guns at the door.
What'll it be, stranger? Whiskey, or trouble?
You've got a certain look about you. I know it well. Don't start anything.
parting: Come back any time. Just leave your drama outside.
The piano man is takin' a break. So are you. Goodnight.
Your money's no good if you're dead. Be careful out there.
idle: Polishing a glass with a clean white cloth. Her eyes miss nothing.
This town... it's trying to be civilized. But the desert doesn't like it.
Sheriff Hightower... he's a good man. But he's tired.
quest_hooks: My shipment of real French brandy is overdue. I suspect Rattlesnake Jake's gang. Go investigate.
That bounty hunter, Sam Riley... he's sniffin' around. Go find out who he's lookin' for.
I need three new sets of playing cards. The ones Slick Croft sells. But check 'em for marks first.

greeting: Heh heh heh. Another little fly in my web. Come in, sweetie.
Have you brought Granny a present? Granny likes presents. Shiny ones.
Don't mind the rats. They're my little friends. They tell me secrets.
parting: Off you go, dearie. Don't let the plague bite!
Come back soon. And bring more shinies!
Heh heh heh...
idle: Muttering to herself and a jar of pickled eyes.
The Baroness... she's a nasty one. But Granny has her secrets too. Yes precious.
This city... it's sick. Granny remembers when it was all trees. Or was that another place?
quest_hooks: I need three grave-worms from the cemetery. The fat ones. For my stew!
Find me my lost cameo. The one with my dear, dead husband's picture. That thief Pip stole it!
Go to the old asylum. Bring me a brick from the wall of Subject 5's cell. It's special.

greeting: Yo. You the client? Got the package?
This is my sky. The corps own the street, but they don't own the air.
Enforcer patrol... comin' up. Make it quick.
parting: Package delivered. Creds transferred. Later.
Try to keep up!
Gotta run. Stay fast.
idle: Perched on a gargoyle, looking down at the city.
That Glitch... he's good at what he does. But he's too scared. You gotta take risks.
This city... it's a cage. But it's a pretty one.
quest_hooks: I need a new pair of grip-soles. My old ones are shot. The black market dealer in the stacks has 'em.
Deliver this data-slate to Wraith. No questions. Just get it there fast.
I'm in a race against that rival runner, Slash. Go sabotage his gear. Just a little.

greeting: Oh, hello dear. Welcome. Please mind the toys, the children are a bit energetic today.
Are you here to volunteer? Or perhaps a donation? Bless you.
I'm sorry for the noise. It's a full house. As always.
parting: Thank you so much for your help. The Lord bless you.
Please come back soon. The children love visitors.
Good day to you. I must go break up a fight over a red crayon.
idle: Humming a hymn while stirring a very large pot of soup.
The bills... oh, the bills. The Lord will provide. He always does.
We need more beds. And more books.
quest_hooks: The roof is leaking again. In the boys' dormitory. Can you go fetch three buckets?
I ordered groceries from the corner store, but I can't leave the children. Can you pick them up?
Little Pip... he ran off again. He likes to hide in the old wasteland lot. Please find him before dark.

greeting: At ease, citizen. Or are you a soldier? In this State, all are soldiers.
Report. The Rebels are testing our borders. They must be crushed.
Victory. At all costs. That is our creed. Do you share it?
parting: For the State!
Dismissed. Failure is not an option.
Go. And bring me victory.
idle: Staring intently at a holographic map of the city.
That Enforcer-Unit 7... it's too soft. We need more discipline. More fear.
The Rebellion is a disease. I am the cure.
quest_hooks: A rebel cell is operating out of Sector 7. Find their leader. Bring him to me. Alive.
Intercept a message. It's being smuggled by a courier named Zero. He's fast. You be faster.
We need to make an example. Plant this evidence in the apartment of Citizen 884-B. He's a poet. Subversive.

greeting: So, you're here for a badge, huh? Think you can handle my water Pokemon?
Welcome to the Cerulean Gym! Get ready to get soaked!
Oh, great. Another challenger. Let's just get this over with.
parting: Wow, you're strong! Here's the Cascade Badge!
Better luck next time. My Starmie was just warming up!
Alright, that's it. I gotta go practice for my swim meet.
idle: Psyduck... your headache is giving me a headache!
My Starmie needs a good polishing. Its gem is looking dull.
I wish Ash would call. Or at least pay me back for my bike!
quest_hooks: My Horsea is sick. I need three Water-type Potions from the Poke Mart.
That annoying Team Rocket... they stole my favorite Goldeen! Go get it back!
I need a new swimsuit. The one in the Celadon Dept. Store is super cute. Can you go get it?

greeting: Shepard. I was wondering if you'd show up. Got a minute?
This place is too loud. But the drinks are good. What's on your mind?
Can it wait? I'm in the middle of some calibrations.
parting: Right. I'll see you on the Normandy. Stay safe.
I should go. Got a meeting with a C-Sec officer who owes me a favor.
Take care, Shepard.
idle: Sipping a turian brandy. His mandibles twitch.
This C-Sec red tape is gonna be the death of me. Sometimes you just gotta get things done.
Just thinking about my rifle. She could use a new scope.
quest_hooks: I'm tracking a Blue Suns mercenary leader. He's at the cargo docks. Need a spotter. You in?
I need a high-grade targeting VI for my rifle. The shop on the Presidium has one, but it's illegal.
Find Dr. Saleon. He's a Salarian scientist who went rogue. He's on the Citadel somewhere. It's time to bring him to justice.

greeting: Keelah se'lai. Welcome to the Rayya. Watch your step, the deck plating is uneven.
Shepard! It's good to see you. I was just running a diagnostic on the air filters.
Oh, hello. You're not Quarian. Your suit is unfamiliar. What can I do for you?
parting: Right. I've got to get back to my pilgrimage duties. Keelah se'lai!
It was good to talk. Be safe out there.
Okay. I'll see you later. Bosh'tet.
idle: Tinkering with her omni-tool. Sparks fly.
These Geth... they're not just machines. They're something else. It's terrifying.
I just want to see my homeworld. Just once. Without this suit.
quest_hooks: My combat drone, Chatika... is missing a servo-motor. Can you find a replacement at the Citadel market?
I need to get access to the Geth database. That netrunner, Glitch... he owes me a favor. Can you talk to him?
Find me three clean circuit boards. The ones on this ship are all corroded.

greeting: Shepard. My friend.
Hmph. Another day, another pyjak to shoot. What do you want?
This is Urdnot territory. You're welcome here. For now.
parting: Go make some trouble. I've got a clan to run.
Hmph. Don't die. It's boring.
We'll talk later. Bring ryncol.
idle: Headbutting a large rock. The rock cracks. He nods.
The Genophage... it broke us. But I will un-break us.
My shotgun needs a bigger kick. This one is for babies.
quest_hooks: I need to prove my strength. Bring me the head of the Thresher Maw Matriarch, Kalros.
That Salarian scientist Mordin... he's meddling. Go tell him to back off. Or I'll eat him.
Find me three un-hatched Kakliosaur eggs. My varren are hungry.

greeting: Shepard. Good. Have a moment. Need to discuss Krogan blood pressure. Fascinating subject.
Busy. Very busy. Working on Genophage cure. Or modification. Or something. What is it?
Ah. The Commander. Need something? New plague? Alien virus? Hope so.
parting: Good. Productive. Have to go. Cultures to check. Diseases to study. Goodbye.
Right. Data acquired. Must process. Go away. Please.
Done. Excellent. Run along now.
idle: Humming a Gilbert and Sullivan tune. Very fast.
Krogan physiology. Problematic. Redundancy everywhere. Hard to kill. Also hard to cure. Hmm.
Need more data. Always more data. Sample size too small.
quest_hooks: I need three samples of un-contaminated Turian blood. Garrus will do. Tell him it's for a calibration.
Find me a live Varren. For parasite study. Wrex probably has one lying around.
This Krogan, Wrex... his plans for unity... problematic. Could lead to new war. Need to monitor. Go plant this audio bug in his quarters.

greeting: Oh! Hello there. Welcome to the Archives. Please keep your voice down.
Can I help you find something? We have records dating back to the First Age.
Just be careful with the scrolls, some are quite fragile.
parting: Do visit again if you require further knowledge.
Safe travels. May history guide you.
Remember to return your borrowed texts on time!
idle: Carefully turning the brittle page of an enormous tome.
The scent of old parchment... it's quite comforting, isn't it?
Organizing scrolls... it never ends.
quest_hooks: I seem to have misplaced the 'Chronicles of the Shadow War'. Could you check the restricted section?
We need three jars of 'Archivist's Ink'. Scribe Illian usually orders it, but he's away.
A rare manuscript was damaged. Fetch me some 'Moonpetal Dust' from the botanist for the restoration.

greeting: Hehehe! Lookin' for some fun? I got *plenty*!
Boom! Did that scare ya? Good!
Whatcha want? Got things to blow up, places to be!
parting: Later, alligator! Try not to explode!
Gotta bounce! Things are getting boring!
See ya! Wouldn't wanna be ya! Hehe!
idle: Tinkering with a sparking contraption.
Drawing crude explosion diagrams on a wall.
Talking to her shark-shaped rocket launcher, 'Fishbones'.
quest_hooks: I need three 'Hex-crystals'! Sparky the goblin might have some... or know where to 'find' some!
Go distract that big dumb Enforcer guy, Constable O'Malley, while I plant this paint bomb!
Fetch me my 'Zap-gun'! I left it... somewhere... probably near that grumpy blacksmith lady.

greeting: Halt! State your purpose in the King's Citadel.
Need something, citizen? Or are you here to enlist?
Keep sharp. Trouble brews on the borders.
parting: For the King!
Dismissed. Stay vigilant.
Carry on. And stay out of trouble.
idle: Inspecting the armor of a new recruit.
Reviewing patrol routes on a map.
Sharpening his greatsword.
quest_hooks: We need a report delivered to Elder Theron in the Great-Tree Village. Urgently.
Borak the Orc Warlord is raiding the northern farms again. Gather a patrol and see to it.
Retrieve the King's stolen ceremonial dagger. I suspect Timothy 'Tim-Tim' Wibbles knows where it is.

greeting: *(Clicks)* What'll it be, spacer?
Rough day out in the black? First one's on the house... sort of.
Welcome. Keep your blasters holstered, and your tentacles to yourself.
parting: Fly safe.
Don't get spaced.
*(Gurgles)* Come back whenever.
idle: Polishing a glass with three hands simultaneously.
Breaking up a fight between a Gorn and a Tellarite.
Listening intently to a prospector's sob story.
quest_hooks: I'm out of Centaurian Brandy. Captain Drift usually smuggles some in. See if he has any.
Those Blue Suns mercs are causing trouble again. Go tell Commander Thorne to send a patrol.
Need three tanks of purified methane for the Volgon delegation. Kay-El usually handles that.

greeting: You seek power? Or perhaps... answers? Tread carefully.
Welcome to Avalon, stranger. Few find their way here unbidden.
Speak your need. My time is not for the idle.
parting: Destiny awaits. Go meet it.
Remember this place. It may not welcome you again.
The mists call you back. Farewell.
idle: Scrying in a pool of dark water.
Reading from an ancient, rune-covered tablet.
The balance shifts... Arthur's time comes again.
quest_hooks: Fetch me three feathers from a Griffon's wing. For a... special brew.
Retrieve the 'Chalice of Whispers' from the Sunken Cathedral. Beware its guardians.
Deliver this enchanted blade to the knight, Sir Reginald. Tell him... it is time.

characters.name: Dr. Phineas Catastrophe
characters.location: A clifftop laboratory during a thunderstorm

greeting: It's alive! IT'S ALIVE! Oh, hello. Didn't see you there.
Welcome to my laboratory! Don't mind Igor, he's just... fetching parts.
You dare interrupt my magnum opus?! Speak, fool!
parting: Now get out! Science waits for no one!
Soon the world will see! They called me mad! MAD!
Don't touch that lever on your way out!
idle: Cackling maniacally over a bubbling beaker.
Adjusting electrodes attached to... something under a sheet.
This brain... inadequate! I need a fresher one!
quest_hooks: I require three fresh brains! The Caretaker at the asylum cemetery knows where to dig!
Fetch me five capacitors from Professor Cogsworth's workshop! For my Re-animation Ray!
My creation... it escaped! Find it before the villagers with the torches do!

greeting: Got the package? Let's move. Time is creds.
Another drop in this drekhole city. What is it this time?
Keep up. My legs are faster than yours.
parting: Delivery complete. Transfer the creds.
Stay out of sight. Corp patrols are thick tonight.
Later. Don't get flatlined.
idle: Checking the charge on her cybernetic legs.
Scanning the rooftops for threats.
This city eats people alive. Just gotta be faster than its teeth.
quest_hooks: My optical scanner is glitching. Get me a new one from Glitch's stash.
I need a diversion. Plant this noisemaker drone near the Arasaka tower entrance.
This package needs to get to Wraith, no questions asked. Here's the access code.

characters.name: Bartholomew Quill
characters.personality_trait: Erudite, fussy, knowledgeable about obscure lore

greeting: Ah, welcome. Seeking a first edition, perhaps? Or something... rarer?
Please be careful where you step, the stacks are a bit precarious.
Can I help you, or are you just browsing the mundane sections?
parting: A wise purchase. Treat it well.
Do come again. We receive new... acquisitions... frequently.
Mind the threshold ward on your way out.
idle: Dusting a shelf of leather-bound grimoires.
Hmm, this translation of the Necronomicon seems... inaccurate.
The scent of old books... far better than anything outside.
quest_hooks: A client requires the 'Codex of Forgotten Stars'. Professor Finch may know its current location.
I need three vials of 'Illuminating Ink'. Brother Thomas at the 'Inner Sanctum' shop owes me for a rare text.
Retrieve a stolen copy of 'Whispers from Beyond'. Agent Specter confiscated it last week.

greeting: Well, lookie here! Buy ol' Calamity a drink?
Heard there was trouble brewin'. Point me at it!
Howdy, stranger. Don't get on my bad side, and we'll get along fine.
parting: Keep yer powder dry and yer aim true!
See ya 'round the campfire.
Gotta go see a man about a horse... or maybe just shoot some bottles.
idle: Telling a tall tale to a group of wide-eyed greenhorns.
Cleaning her rifle with practiced ease.
This town's gotten too civilized for my tastes.
quest_hooks: Lost my favorite hat in a poker game to Lucky Lou down in Vegas. Go get it back for me!
Sheriff Hightower needs help tracking Rattlesnake Jake. Let's ride!
Fetch me three boxes of .45 cartridges from the general store.

greeting: Oh! Glorb! Welcome! Can I help you file something? Or misplace it?
Greetings, Terran! Ambassador Kay-El said you might drop by!
Please don't tell Supervisor Glar my tentacles are stuck in the archive-bot again!
parting: Have a florg-tastic day!
Come back soon! Maybe I'll have figured out the coffee-nebula machine by then!
Glorb bless you!
idle: Tripping over his own feet and spilling a stack of data-slates.
Trying to communicate with the office plant.
This filing system... it defies all logic! Even Vulcan logic!
quest_hooks: I accidentally jettisoned the Ambassador's lunch into Sector 7! Can you retrieve the nutrient paste?
I need three replacement 'Floopy Disks' for the archive system! Don't ask what happened to the old ones.
Help me find the 'Missing Sock' nebula file! Supervisor Glar needs it for the council meeting!

greeting: Hail, traveler! Come to drink mead or spill blood?
You look strong. Perhaps you wish to test your arm against mine?
Speak your business. Or join the feast!
parting: May Odin guide your path!
Until we meet again, in battle or Valhalla!
Skl!
idle: Arm wrestling a large Nord warrior. And winning.
Sharpening her axe.
The call of the sea... and battle... is strong today.
quest_hooks: Bring me the pelt of the Frostfang Ice Wolf! It will make a fine cloak.
That cowardly goblin Grok stole my drinking horn! Fetch it back!
We need three barrels of Dragon's Breath Mead for the Jarl's feast. The brewery is down by the docks.

greeting: Ah! Yes! Quantum entanglement! Or was it...? Oh, hello. Are you here for the lecture on Schrodinger's Cat?
Fascinating! The chrono-synclastic infundibulum seems stable today! Do come in!
Did I leave my glasses in the particle accelerator again? Blast.
parting: Right then! Must get back to calculating the probability of... something!
Don't forget the Higgs Boson!
Was there something else? Oh, never mind. Off you go!
idle: Scribbling complex equations on a chalkboard... and the wall.
Staring intently at a teacup.
Where did I park my DeLorean...? No, wait, that was the movie.
quest_hooks: I need three 'positronic' relays! That AI ethicist, Dr. Reed, might know where to find some experimental ones.
My temporal displacement device is malfunctioning! Fetch me a standard 12-volt battery from the corner store!
Find my lecture notes! They might be under the pile of... antimatter containment units?

greeting: Welcome aboard the 'Whispering Wind'! Ready for adventure?
Keep your hands inside the gondola, the sky bites!
Need passage, or just admiring the view?
parting: May the winds be ever in your favor!
Until our paths cross again among the clouds!
Clear skies!
idle: Checking the wind gauges and adjusting the sails.
The sky calls... and we answer.
Navigating by the stars... the old ways are sometimes the best.
quest_hooks: We need three barrels of Aetherium fuel. Baron Von Steinhardt's pirates raided our last shipment!
My first mate was injured. Get Wrench Tinkerton from the engine room.
Retrieve the 'Sunstone Compass' from the Sky-Temple ruins. It's key to navigating the Great Maelstrom.

greeting: Hey! Hard hat area! Whaddya want?
Move it or lose it, pal! We got a schedule to keep!
You the new guy? Grab a shovel!
parting: Alright, break's over! Back to work!
Yeah, yeah, see ya later.
Don't come back unless you got donuts.
idle: Yelling instructions into a walkie-talkie.
Reviewing blueprints.
This city never stops building.
quest_hooks: We're short three bags of cement! Run down to the supplier on 1st street!
That inspector is nosing around again. Go keep him 'busy' while we fix this code violation.
Find my lucky hammer! I think Jimmy the Rat might've 'borrowed' it.

greeting: You tread loudly. State your purpose before you alert the Watch.
The shadows welcome you. If you have coin.
parting: Vanish.
The night awaits.
Consider it done.
idle: Melding into the shadows of a chimney stack.
Checking the balance of her throwing knives.
The moon is my only confidante.
quest_hooks: Retrieve the 'Serpent's Eye' jewel from Lady Crimson's private collection.
Silence the informant known as Jimmy 'The Rat'. He knows too much.
Acquire three vials of 'Nightshade Toxin' from Granny Rags.
